sen.j: 豊鍬入姫命（とよすきいりびめのみこと、生没年未詳）は、記紀に伝えられる古墳時代の皇族。
sen.e: Toyosukiiribime no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who was said to be living during the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 記紀→統一用語では the Kojiki (The Records of Ancient Matters) and the Nihonshoki (Chronicle of Japan)とするよう指示がありましたが、書物名初出なので、他の書物同様に"Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicle of Japan)としました
sen.e: Toyosukiiribime no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who is said to have lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: was said to be living during を is said to have lived in に変更
sen.e: Toyosukiiribime no mikoto (year of birth and death unknown) was a member of the Imperial family, who is said to have lived in the Kofun period (tumulus period) according to "Kojiki" (The Records of Ancient Matters) and "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
She was Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).
She was Saigu (Imperial Princess appointed to serve the deities of the Ise-jingu Shrine).

sen.j: 『日本書紀』には豊鍬入姫命または豊耜入姫命、『古事記』では豊鉏入日売命。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki, her name was written as 豊鍬入姫命 or 豊耜入姫命, while in the Kojiki, it was written as 豊鉏入日売命.
sen.cmt: 名前の漢字表記を加えました。
sen.e: In the Nihonshoki, her name was written as 豊鍬入姫命 or 豊耜入姫命, while in the Kojiki, it was written as 豊鉏入日売命.
In the Nihonshoki, her name was written as 豊鍬入姫命 or 豊耜入姫命, while in the Kojiki, it was written as 豊鉏入日売命.

sen.j: 崇神天皇の皇女で、母は紀国造荒河戸畔（あらかわとべ）の娘、遠津年魚眼眼妙媛。
sen.e: She was the Imperial Princess of Emperor Suijin, and her mother was the daughter of Kinokuni no miyatsuko Arakawatobe, named Totsuayumemaaguwashi-hime.
sen.cmt: 遠津年魚眼眼妙媛→Totsuayumemaaguwashi-hime 名前が長いので読みづらく感じます。表記方法をご検討ください。
sen.e: She was the Imperial Princess of Emperor Suijin, and her mother was a daughter of Kinokuni no miyatsuko Arakawatobe, named Totsuayumemaaguwashi-hime.
sen.cmt: daugherの冠詞をthe からaに変更
sen.e: She was the Imperial Princess of Emperor Suijin, and her mother was a daughter of Kinokuni no miyatsuko Arakawatobe, named Totsuayumemaaguwashi-hime.

sen.j: 同母兄に豊城入彦命が、異母兄弟に垂仁天皇、八坂入彦命らがいる。
sen.e: Her elder half brother by the same mother was Toyokiiribiko no mikoto, and her half brothers by different mothers were Emperor Suinin and Yasakairibiko no mikoto.
Her elder half brother by the same mother was Toyokiiribiko no mikoto, and her half brothers by different mothers were Emperor Suinin and Yasakairibiko no mikoto.
Her elder half brother by the same mother was Toyokiiribiko no mikoto, and her half brothers by different mothers were Emperor Suinin and Yasakairibiko no mikoto.

sen.j: 崇神天皇6年（紀元前92年）、父天皇の命で天照大神を笠縫邑（かさぬいのむら）に祀る。
sen.e: In the sixth year of Emperor Suijin's rein (B.C.92), she dedicated herself to enshrine Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at Kasanuinomura Village by the Imperial order of her father.
sen.cmt: 崇神天皇6年→定訳不明：In the sixth year of Emperor Suijin's rein としました。 父天皇の命→ Imperial order of her fatherとしました。
sen.e: In the sixth year of Emperor Suijin's rein (92 B.C.), she dedicated herself to enshrine Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at Kasanuinomura Village by the Imperial order of her father.
sen.cmt: B.C. 92 を 92 B.C. の表記に変更
sen.e: In the sixth year of Emperor Suijin's rein (92 B.C.), she dedicated herself to enshrine Amaterasu Omikami (the Sun Goddess) at Kasanuinomura Village by the Imperial order of her father.

sen.j: 以後、垂仁天皇25年（紀元前5年）3月10日 (旧暦)に倭姫命と交替になるまで、祭祀を続けたという。
sen.e: Afterwards, she continued running its rites and festival until Yamato hime no mikoto took over the charge on the tenth day of the third month of 25th year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar) (B.C.5)
sen.cmt: 垂仁天皇25年（紀元前5年）3月10日→定訳不明：the tenth day of the third month of 25th year of Emperor Suinin's reign としました。
sen.e: Afterwards, she continued running its rites and festival until Yamato hime no mikoto took over the charge on the tenth day of the third month of 25th year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar) (5 B.C.).
sen.cmt: B.C. 5 を 5 B.C. の表記に変更
sen.e: Afterwards, she continued running its rites and festival until Yamato hime no mikoto took over the charge on the tenth day of the third month of 25th year of Emperor Suinin's reign (old lunar calendar) (5 B.C.).

sen.j: ホケノ山古墳（奈良県桜井市）を豊鍬入姫の墳墓とする伝承がある。
sen.e: According to a myth Hokenoyama Tomb (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture) is her tomb.
According to a myth, Hokenoyama Tomb (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture) is her tomb.
sen.cmt: mythの直後にカンマを追加
sen.e: According to a myth, Hokenoyama Tomb (Sakurai City, Nara Prefecture) is her tomb.

sen.j: なお、豊鍬入姫命を邪馬台国を治めた台与に比定する説がある。
sen.e: There is a theory that identifies Toyosukiiribime no mikoto as Toyo who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
There is a theory that identifies Toyosukiiribime no mikoto as Toyo who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
There is a theory that identifies Toyosukiiribime no mikoto as Toyo who governed Yamatai-Koku kingdom.
